snippet: Trailers and TV ads are tough marketing tools to use in China, but the service Mtime offers packages to help American filmmakers reach a huge, and quickly growing, audience.
abstract: American film studios, seeking to advertise to new market in China, are increasingly relying on Mtime, company founded in 2005 by former Microsoft executive Kelvin Hou; Mtime combines review aggregation, online ticket services and other features that reach roughly 160 million users per month; company's paid advertising services have become indispensable to film studios in country where traditional film advertising methods like television and trailers are not practical.

byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and AMY QIN
byline.contributor: Brooks Barnes reported from Los Angeles and Amy Qin from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Trailers and TV ads are tough marketing tools to use in China, but the service Mtime offers packages to help American filmmakers reach a huge, and quickly growing, audience.

headline.main: Mtime Helps Hollywood Clear China’s Marketing Hurdles and Reach Fans
headline.print_headline: Reaching Film Fans in China, Differently
